intro: Pycreus acaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed pycreus, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its lack of a visible stem, with the plant growing directly from the root system. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and often appear as a dense rosette at the base. Pycreus acaulis is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments.
